Yo! Check out %s Check out %1$s, this icon pack is really cool! %2$s
Navigation drawer Tap here or swipe from the left edge of the screen to open the navigation drawer Apply icon pack Tap here to apply %s to your current launcher. Long press to apply to other launchers. Search Tap here to search for an icon Select missed app Tap here to select missed app for icon request Select all missed apps Tap here to select all missed apps for icon request Send icon request Tap here to send selected missed apps Premium icon request Tap here to buy the premium icon request package, with a premium icon request, you can get your requested apps faster. Wallpaper options Tap and hold here to show wallpaper options; %s apply wallpaper. download or Preview wallpaper Tap here to preview the full size of the wallpaper Save wallpaper Tap here to download and save wallpaper to your device so you can use it later Apply wallpaper Tap here to set wallpaper as the homescreen background

Installed Launcher Installed Launchers Supported Launchers
%1$s Launcher doesn\'t support direct apply, but you can apply %2$s manually from the launcher settings. Kvaesitso doesn\'t support direct apply but you can follow these steps: Open Kvaesitso\'s settings Tap \"Grid & Icons\" Tap on the \"Icon Pack\" Choose %s from the list Tap the paint brush icon to enable or disable the background shape KISS doesn\'t support direct apply, but you can follow these steps: Open KISS settings Tap \"User Interface\" Tap on the \"Icon Pack\" Choose %s from the list %1$s doesn\'t support direct apply, but starting with %2$s you can apply icons with a companion app. Your current version of %s is too old. Please update to Android 12 or newer to be able to apply icons directly. Alternatively, you can install a different launcher. Open %s Download the app %s Tap \"Icon\" Tap \"Create New\" Tap the blue \"Iconpack\" button Choose %s from the list Repeat these steps each time you update %s as new icons won\'t be mapped automatically. HiOS launcher doesn\'t support direct apply, but you can follow these steps: Open \"Settings\" Tap \"Theme & Lockscreen\" Tap \"My theme\" Tap \"Icon pack\" Tap %s Long-tap your homescreen Tap \"Home Settings\" Tap \"Icon Pack\" Tap %s Long-tap your homescreen Tap \"Icons\" Scroll to the right of the \"Custom\" button (this is a scrollable list!) Tap %s This version of Before Launcher does not yet support applying icons directly. Instead, follow the steps below: Swipe left on homescreen Tap \"Settings\" Tap \"Styles & Themes\" Tap \"Icon Styles & Packs\" Tap %s Open \"Settings\" Tap \"Customization\" Tap \"Icon Pack\" Tap %s Unable to launch %s settings %s Launcher is not installed. Do you want to open Google Play Store to download and install it?
%s Launcher is not installed. Please try again after installing the launcher.
CM Theme Manager is not available on this device Unable to launch CM Theme Manager, you can try to apply the Icon Pack manually from Settings.
To apply this Icon Pack open Settings - Display - Home Screen - Theme LG Home is not available on this device Unable to launch LG Home Settings, you can try to apply the Icon Pack manually from Settings. LG Home with Android Nougat no longer supports Icon Pack. You need a custom launcher to use Icon Pack.
%s Launcher doesn\'t support any icon packs, so you can\'t use this icon pack with this launcher. You can try a third-party app to use this icon pack in the %2$s launcher. Do you want to install it? %s launcher doesn\'t support icon packs on Android %d or lower. Please update your Android version or install a third-party launcher to use this icon pack. You can also try a helper app to change individual icons. Do you want to install it?
Unable to load icons Icon Shape No bookmarks found. Bookmark icons to quickly access them here. %d selected

Building request … Sending request to Pacific Manager... Error occurred while sending a request to Pacific Manager. Error is %s Successfully sent request to Pacific Manager Error occurred while sending an icon request. If this error persists, contact the developer. %s Successfully sent icon request Fetching latest data … Unable to build icon request Unable to read appfilter.xml You already requested this icon and cannot request it again. You already requested this icon. Are you sure you want to spend another request on it? Go back Select anyway Choose the app you want to use to send the icon request You\'re using an older version of this icon pack. The requested icons may be included in the latest version. Please update your app to the latest version to request icons. Unable to load data from server. Please, check your network connection. An error occurred while fetching or reading data from the server.
You can only make %d request(s) with regular request. You have requested %d icon(s). You can buy Premium Requests to request more icons. Icon request limit will be reset on every update.
Regular Icon Request Get your icon requested, and the developer will try to include icons you requested. Total\n%d request Used\n%d request Available\n%d request
Premium Icon Request Make sure your phone is connected to the internet before sending a premium request Premium icon request is a pay-to request. You can get your requested apps faster by using a premium icon request. Buy Total\n%d request Used\n%d request Available\n%d request You still have %d premium request. You need to use all of them before buying a premium request package again. You only have %d premium request(s), but you selected %d app(s). \n\nYou need to use all of your premium requests before using regular request again.
Unable to use Premium Request, make sure you have a stable internet connection and try again. Go to Settings to rebuild Premium Requests.
Rebuilding Premium Request … You have not made a Premium Request
You still have a Premium Icon Request package. Open Settings, choose \"Restore Purchases\" to restore it.
You need to buy a premium icon request package to make icon requests

CandyBar CandyBar is an open-source icon pack dashboard licensed under Apache License 2.0 for Android available on GitHub and free to use, developed by Dani Mahardhika. Open-Source Licenses CandyBar Contributors CandyBar Translator
